intro: Erysimum purpureum var. turkestanicum, commonly known as the Turkestan wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant purple to pink flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are borne in racemes and are attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders.
